exhibition_department: Historic: Art of Africa and the Americas
exhibition_title: Masks from the West-African Dan People
exhibition_description:
Masks are the most important art form of the Dan, who live on either side of the border between Liberia and CÃ´te d'Ivoire. This installation includes about 10 masks, from the MIA and from two local collectors. The exhibition's purpose is twofold: to show the variety of forms of Dan masks, and to highlight the diversity of their functions.
This exhibition is the first one of a series of small-scale experimental installations that will inform the redesign of the African galleries and will incorporate technological innovations.
